arm_group.description: Isolate Aerobic Exercise Training for 4 months
Isolate Inspiratory Muscle Training for 4 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: Aerobic Exercise Training + Inspiratory Muscle Training
arm_group.description: Aerobic Exercise Training associated with Inspiratory Muscle Training for 4 months

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesize that aerobic exercise training associated with respiratory
      muscle training will cause additional benefits in the autonomic control and respiratory
      function compared to isolated exercise training or respiratory training in chronic heart
      failure patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Training Associated With Inspiratory Muscle Training in Heart Failure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with systolic heart failure and New York Heart Association (NYHA) class
             II-III

          -  Left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40%

          -  Peak Oxygen Consumption less than 20 ml/Kg/min

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

          -  Neuromuscular, Orthopedic, Neurologic and Neoplastic Diseases

          -  Recent myocardial infarction or cardiac surgery (less than 6 months)

          -  Unstable angina pectoris

          -  Atrial Fibrillation

          -  Pacemakers users

          -  Actual Smoker

          -  Pregnant

          -  Changing medication or hospital admission

arm_group_label: Aerobic Exercise Training + Inspiratory Muscle Training

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Aerobic Exercise Training Associated With Inspiratory Muscle Training in Patients With Heart Failure

primary_outcome.description: Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will reduce sympathetic nerve activity.
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will improve respiratory muscle strength and resistance.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

secondary_outcome.description: Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will improve peak oxygen consumption
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will improve quality of life
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will reduces blood inflammatory markers
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will increase skeletal muscle strength

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
